title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal proceedings are ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft announced that the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up the operating system without needing an internet connection or logging into an account.
summary: Microsoft's latest Windows 11 Insider Preview update will eliminate a script that let users install the operating system without an internet connection or a Microsoft account.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon is holding its Big Spring Sale until March 31st, offering numerous deals on a variety of items, accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale features over 100 discounts on popular products, alongside a selection of affordable alternatives.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until March 31st, providing significant discounts on a wide range of products. This sale, open to all customers without the need for an Amazon Prime membership, includes more than 100 deals on popular items as well as budget-friendly options.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X, previously known as Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, with the latter including $12 billion in debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk initially bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. The deal values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion of debt. This move follows Musk's original purchase of Twitter for $44 billion a few years ago.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that fail to boot. This feature, first announced last year, is a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11, designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that won't start. This development, first revealed last year, aims to prevent issues like the past Crowdstrike incident.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This update follows the company's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, after which it began integrating Fitbit's services with its own.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year. This decision comes after Google acquired Fitbit in early 2021 and started combining Fitbit's services with its own.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
snippets: The Metals Company (TMC), aiming to initiate deep-sea mining, has sought closer ties with the Trump administration following obstacles in global talks. Initially backed by Nauru, TMC's efforts in 2021 spurred efforts to establish regulations for deep-sea mining.
summary: The Metals Company (TMC), focused on starting deep-sea mining, sought to strengthen its relationship with the Trump administration after facing challenges in international discussions. Supported by Nauru in 2021, TMC's actions accelerated the process to create rules for deep-sea mining.

title: Four Afghan girl guitarists escaped the Taliban. Will they be forced back?

summary: Four Afghan girls, aged 7, named Yasemin, Zakia, Shukriya, and Uzra, fled Afghanistan due to safety concerns. Now in Pakistan, they risk deportation due to a Trump-era order and Pakistan's refugee policies.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'
snippets: Researchers have developed a growth factor cocktail that successfully reversed lethal cell damage caused by anthrax in mice. This finding suggests the potential for adapting this treatment for use in humans.
summary: Researchers have created a treatment that reverses deadly cell damage from anthrax in mice, indicating it might be adapted for human use.

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have developed a new model using AI and machine learning to predict chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients more accurately. This advanced model combines whole-slide tumor imaging data with gene expression analyses, significantly improving predictions over older methods that relied on a single data type.
summary: Researchers have created an advanced model that combines AI and machine learning with whole-slide tumor imaging and gene expression data to more accurately predict chemotherapy outcomes for patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer. This method marks an improvement over previous models that used only one type of data.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a connection between dopamine levels in the brain and cognitive flexibility, using PET imaging to observe increased dopamine production during challenging tasks. This relationship suggests that higher dopamine release improves task efficiency. This finding could lead to more targeted treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Researchers have found that higher dopamine levels in the brain are linked to improved cognitive flexibility, observed through PET imaging showing increased dopamine production during difficult tasks. This discovery indicates that boosting dopamine release could enhance task performance and offers new avenues for treating neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This insight could aid in understanding how to control latency in other nervous system infections.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and control the inactive stage of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite, offering potential insights for managing latency in various nervous system infections.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study examining nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has identified environmental conditions and dispersal barriers as key factors influencing why certain plants thrive in specific regions but not in others. The research aims to understand the patterns of plant distribution and how they have evolved over millions of years.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species has found that environmental conditions and dispersal barriers significantly impact why plants are found in certain areas but not others. The research seeks to comprehend plant distribution patterns and their evolution over millions of years.
